result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jareid N Tally is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jareid N Tally

records.addlTxt: Attorney William Joseph Reddin previously in court.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. TAPE NUMBER: 4:57pm.  Defense provided obituary. State confirmed.   On motion of the State, Court ordered case abate.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussion of defendant's nonappearance placed on the record. Defense requests status conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Per the court's instruction due to a pending snowstorm on 12/16/2016 the case is adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 31.  Attorney Reddin has informed the court that he has contacted the defendant regarding the re--scheduled court date.  ADA Phillip Kovoor is informed of the new court date in court.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jareid N Tally in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court.  Defendant not in court due to medical reasons.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time for reasons placed on the record.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for status conference.  For reasons stated on the record, defendant's appearance is waived for this court hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant remains hospitalized but was unable to provide verification of such at this time.  Defense counsel will provide verification upon receipt of the information.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jareid N Tally in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jareid N Tally in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 21.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or any dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jareid N Tally in court with attorney Terese J. Singer.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape #16-010
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01-15-2016
